page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY CONTD
page.content: On the walls inside,memorials are found to the de Sausmarez and Carey families who were rivals for many generations.{TRADITIONS}Outside St Martins Church there is a 4ft high granite figure which is believed to be a Bronze Age fertility symbol reworked in the Gallo-Roman period or later. She is called the Grande Mere du Chinquiere.When a couple are married at the church,the bride is supposed to leave some silver on her head,to bless the marriage with children.She is one of two such figures in the island the other of which is in the Castel Church.Guernsey churches are commonly on Pre-Christian cult sites.
